result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob M Tornai

records.addlTxt: 11:00 AM Defendant Jacob M Tornai in court.  Attorney Tess Lewangowski in court for State of Wisconsin. DE states he has been approved for SPD appointment, counsel has not yet been assigned. Court finds good cause, sets status conference for 11-22 at 8:30am.
Status conference on November 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
SPD Appointment of Counsel Report:  Defn is Eligible for SPD services.  Atty not appointed yet.
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS)

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
The Court ordered a signature bond on the condition that the defendant reports to and complies with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _x_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Amelia M. 
- Defendant shall not be at or around 80 N Walbridge Ave in Madison.
- Defendant shall not be in the 400 block of W Lincoln Dr in Deforest.
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 13

2:06 PM Defendant Jacob M Tornai in court, in custody.  Attorney Crystal A Vera in court for Jacob M Tornai.  Prosecuting attorney Tim Helmberger in court for the State of Wisconsin. Appearance by victim via Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. Statement by victim.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
